attributes.action: make the 11 November a Bank Holiday to remember the sacrifice of those men and women who have died or suffered in wars and conflicts and all those who have served during the past.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
At 11am on 11 November we pause to remember the sacrifice of those men and women who have died or suffered in wars and conflicts and all those who have served during the past and in the present conflicts.

A Bank Holiday on this day will commemorate the nations commitment to the principles of peace and freedom. To remember this anniversary in such a way would ensure it was never forgotten and would show that Her Majesty's Government is willing to pledge greater, and public support, for war veterans and war dead.

Remembrance Day (United Kingdom, Australia, Canada)
Poppy Day (South Africa and Malta), 
Armistice Day (United Kingdom, New Zealand and many other Commonwealth countries; and the original name of the holiday internationally)
